title: Double Free in io_allocate_scq_urings error path
concept: If `io_create_region` fails for the SQ region, `io_rings_free` is called. Later, `io_ring_ctx_free` calls `io_rings_free` again.
preconditions: High memory pressure to trigger allocation failure
description: In `io_allocate_scq_urings`, if the second `io_create_region` call fails, `io_rings_free(ctx)` is called. The function then returns error. `io_uring_create` catches the error and calls `io_ring_ctx_wait_and_kill`, which eventually calls `io_ring_ctx_free`. `io_ring_ctx_free` calls `io_rings_free(ctx)` again. This would be a double free if `io_free_region` were not idempotent.
proposed_fix_summary: io_free_region correctly zeros the struct, making it idempotent.

title: Atomic Memory Exhaustion via CQ Overflow
concept: Unbounded allocation of `io_overflow_cqe` structures using `GFP_ATOMIC` allows depleting system-wide atomic reserves.
description: When the CQ ring is full, `io_req_complete_post` calls `io_cqe_overflow_locked`. This function calls `io_alloc_ocqe` with `GFP_ATOMIC` (because `completion_lock` is held). The allocated `ocqe` is added to `ctx->cq_overflow_list`. There is no limit on the length of this list. A malicious user can flood the ring with completions (e.g., using NOPs) while not reaping events, causing massive `GFP_ATOMIC` allocations. While `__GFP_ACCOUNT` is used, if the user has a large memcg limit (or root), they can exhaust the global atomic reserve, causing denial of service for other subsystems (networking, storage).
proposed_fix_summary: Limit the number of pending overflow CQEs. Drop events if the limit is reached, setting the overflow bit.

title: Integer Overflow in rings_size calculation
concept: Overflow in `rings_size` could lead to undersized allocation.
description: `rings_size` calculates offsets and sizes. `off = size_mul(off, 2)` for `IORING_SETUP_CQE32`. `sq_array_size` calculation uses `array_size`. `size_add` is used. All these functions check for overflow and return `SIZE_MAX` or error. The result is checked against `SIZE_MAX` or negative return.

title: Use-After-Free in io_req_complete_post
description: `io_req_complete_post` calls `req_ref_put(req)`. It does not access `req` afterwards. Safe.

title: Race condition in io_poll_check
description: `io_iopoll_check` holds `uring_lock`. `io_iopoll_try_reap_events` holds `uring_lock`. `io_poll_issue` holds `uring_lock` (via `io_tw_lock`? No, `io_poll_issue` is called from task work). `io_poll_issue` calls `__io_issue_sqe`. `io_iopoll_req_issued` takes `uring_lock` if `IO_URING_F_UNLOCKED`. Locking seems consistent.

title: Lost Wakeup in io_req_local_work_add
concept: Integer overflow of `nr_tw` causes wakeup check failure.
description: `req->nr_tw = nr_tw_prev + 1`. If `nr_tw` overflows to 0, the check `if (nr_tw < nr_wait)` might be false negative. However, creating 4 billion requests is impossible due to memory limits.

title: Invalid io_uring_enter flags combination
description: `io_uring_enter` checks `flags & ~IORING_ENTER_FLAGS`. It also handles `IORING_ENTER_REGISTERED_RING`. Logic handles mutual exclusion implicitly or allows it.

title: io_get_ext_arg_reg integer overflow
description: `check_add_overflow` is used for `offset + size`. `array_index_nospec` is used. Safe.

title: io_sq_offload_create partial failure
concept: Failure in creating SQ poll thread leaves dangling state.
description: If `io_sq_offload_create` fails, `io_uring_create` calls `io_ring_ctx_wait_and_kill`, which cleans up via `io_sq_thread_finish`. Robust.

title: Type Confusion in SQE128 mixed mode
description: `io_init_req` checks `def->is_128`. If true and not `IORING_SETUP_SQE128`, it requires `IORING_SETUP_SQE_MIXED`. If not mixed, returns `-EINVAL`. Safe.

title: io_uring_mmap NOMMU kernel address leak
concept: On NOMMU, mmap returns kernel virtual address.
description: `io_uring_get_unmapped_area` returns the kernel address of the ring. This is standard behavior for NOMMU but technically an info leak. It allows userspace to know where the ring is.

title: io_queue_sqe_fallback link corruption
concept: Incorrect handling of links during fallback.
description: `req_fail_link_node` sets `REQ_F_FAIL`. `io_submit_fail_init` correctly breaks the link and fails the chain. Safe.

title: io_submit_sqes loop bounded
description: Loop is `while (--left)`. `left` is derived from `nr` (u32). Safe.

title: io_cqring_wait timeout overflow
description: `timespec64_to_ktime` handles range. `ktime_add` handles overflow (saturates?). Ktime is s64. Safe.

title: io_req_defer_failed lock assertion
description: `lockdep_assert_held` confirms lock is held. Callers (`io_queue_sqe`, `io_submit_fail_init`) hold it. Safe.

title: io_alloc_hash_table overflow
description: `kvmalloc_array` checks overflow. Loop ensures valid bits. Safe.

title: io_file_get_fixed OOB
concept: Accessing fixed file array out of bounds.
description: `io_rsrc_node_lookup` handles lookup. `io_slot_file` accesses safely? `io_rsrc_node_lookup` should check bounds. (In `rsrc.c`).

title: io_req_sqe_copy double copy
description: Checks `REQ_F_SQE_COPIED`. Returns 0 if already copied. Safe.

title: io_uring_create accounting leak
description: If error, `io_ring_ctx_wait_and_kill` calls `io_ring_ctx_free` which calls `mmdrop`. Safe.

title: io_fill_cqe_req infinite loop
description: Returns false if full. Caller handles logic. Safe.

title: io_cqring_overflow_kill deadlock
description: `io_cqring_overflow_kill` calls `__io_cqring_overflow_flush`. `io_ring_exit_work` calls it under `uring_lock`. `io_cqring_do_overflow_flush` takes `uring_lock`. Check usage in `io_ring_ctx_free` -> `io_cqring_overflow_kill`. `io_ring_ctx_free` takes `uring_lock`? No, it calls `mutex_lock(&ctx->uring_lock)`. `io_cqring_overflow_kill` does NOT take `uring_lock`. `__io_cqring_overflow_flush` asserts held. Correct.

title: io_poll_add flags check
description: Checks flags for allowed bits. Safe.

title: io_accept multishot overflow
description: Generates many CQEs. Can trigger the confirmed Atomic Exhaustion vulnerability.

title: io_splice deadlock
description: Splice to/from same pipe? Handled by VFS. Safe.

title: io_msg_ring cycle
concept: Ring A sends to Ring B sends to Ring A.
description: Not infinite loop in kernel (requires user action to process). Safe.

title: io_msg_ring overflow
description: Target CQ overflow logic applies. Can trigger Atomic Exhaustion on target.

title: io_uring in io_uring read
description: Not supported (no read op). Returns -EINVAL? Safe.

title: io_iopoll_check cpu usage
description: Loops but checks . Safe from kernel lockup, user cpu usage allowed.
